conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the semi-cylindrical object given no light rays are emitted from the right side when light is at point C.
Light ray enters the semi-cylindrical object at point C, distance OC = (sqrt(3)/3)R, radius R.
Using triangle OAC, calculate AC using Pythagorean theorem: AC = (R*sqrt(6))/3.
Calculate angle of incidence using trigonometry: sin(theta_i) = (sqrt(3)/3), theta_i = arcsin(sqrt(3)/3).
For total internal reflection, angle of incidence must be >= critical angle theta_c.
Critical angle theta_c is given by sin(theta_c) = 1/n.
Conclude refractive index n = sqrt(3) as condition for no light emission is met.
